text: Can someone please help me out, I am not getting result page in system page option of HubSpot backed. only getting 404 and 500 pages.

Hello <@U04PAC9TY6B>

You can go to the @HubSpot folder and clone the search-result.html page from Growth theme. Issue will be solve.

See the screenshot below
Is there something to fully clone one portal to another portal? We have a staging portal and we would like to test with the exact same theme and data

:wave-yeti: hi all, i just joined this slack team. let me know if i'm asking this in the right place!

here's my question: anyone have advice on how to add ~250 blog posts to a HubSpot developer acct? more context:

• my company uses a HubSpot developer test acct to host blog posts
• in late 2022, the developer test account was limited to 100 blog posts (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/new-limits-on-developer-test-accounts-starting-12/19/2022|link>)
• just once, i need to add ~250 blog posts to our HubSpot developer acct
• i looked at the CMS pricing page (<https://app.HubSpot.com/pricing/20410756/cms?upgradeSource=product-upgrade-button&term=annual&products=cms-hub-starter_1|link>), but i'm not sure any of these routes will help
• i called sales support, and they suggested i come here! :dance:
Well that's a little challenging, you really can't get around that limit, what is your end goal?
you could setup a sandbox account tied to your production account and do it that way (I think)

thanks for the quick response, <@U01QVR44MEY>!

• we use HubSpot blog posts for in-product content
• and a layer on top those HubSpot blog posts organizes them into user guides
• we use a mixture of hubDB/HubSpot blog posts to manage those user guides...
• ...but we want to bring user guide mgmt. in-house
my approach was this:

1. clone prod user guides/blog posts -> staging
2. launch new user guide feature (staging -> prod)
3. ...but i need to clone ~250 blog posts
Could someone lend some guidance on how to use Google Autocomplete for a HubSpot standard address field?
Just FYI I just ran a test and got 101 blog posts to show up on a sandbox account not the same things as a dev test account
so you should be able to clone those blogs if you have a high enough tier level
Well you could built out a custom form and submit the form data through the api: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/forms_overview>

you could also use the advanced form options to check and correct the input each time someone types using the advanced forms options: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options>
this second option is a little more challenging and you leave a lot of customizability options
